org.eclipse.papyrus.designer.components.transformation.core.transformations.container

Class ContainerTrafo

  • java.lang.Object

extends AbstractContainerTrafo
    Make the container transformation, i.e. add elements into a container

      • portInfo

        protected Map<org.eclipse.uml2.uml.Property,org.eclipse.uml2.uml.Port> portInfo
        Store information about intercepted port. The map contains a mapping from the part representing a reified connector to the port that was intercepted. It is stored, since it might be used by instance configurators that configure the container instance.

      • moveSlots

        public void moveSlots(org.eclipse.uml2.uml.InstanceSpecification containerIS)
        Move a slot from the executor instance specification to an instance specification of an extension/interceptor. This is required, since users cannot configure containers directly. The modification is done in the target model, i.e. the user model is not affected. Configuration is based on the idea that we can have multiple classifiers for an instance specification and that we add additional slots for attributes of the 2nd classifier which becomes "visible" after container transformation. Main use: configure priority of thread within container. TODO: Not clear, whether we should keep this operation, since configuration of elements that are not (directly) part of the user model is confusing. Application was: configuration of thread priorities within container.

      • createConnectorForAssociations

        public void createConnectorForAssociations()
        Create an connector for parts that have an association. The rationale behind this is support connections between the state machine in the container and the executor.

      • finalize

        public void finalize()
        Description copied from class: AbstractContainerTrafo
        Is called after a set of rule applications. Does nothing by default
        Overrides:
        finalize in class AbstractContainerTrafo

      • discoverServices

        public void discoverServices()
        Connector ports of executor with compatible ports offered by container extensions (runtime system)

      • getContainerTrafo

        public static ContainerTrafo getContainerTrafo(org.eclipse.uml2.uml.InstanceSpecification containerInstance)
        Return the containerTrafo associated with a container. This operation is useful for instance configurators that need more information about the container context, in particular to associate a part with a port that is intercepted.
        Parameters:
        containerInstance - the container instance (the parent instance of an instance of a container extension)ight be a container instance)
        Returns:
        the containerTrafo info, if found.

      • getExecutorSlot

        public static org.eclipse.uml2.uml.Slot getExecutorSlot(org.eclipse.uml2.uml.InstanceSpecification containerInstance)
        Utility function to retrieve the executor slot, when given the container instance. Needs to be called, after a container instance has been created.
        Parameters:
        containerInstance - the instance of a container specification
        Returns:
        the associated executor slot, or null, if it cannot be found

      • getInterceptedPort

        public org.eclipse.uml2.uml.Port getInterceptedPort(org.eclipse.uml2.uml.Property containerPart)
        Return the port that is intercepted when given a part
        Parameters:
        containerPart - a part that participates in a port interception
        Returns:
        intercepted port
